sub_topic: Finding the maximum flow in a network.
message_1:
Consider the following network:

![Network image](https://i.imgur.com/UapxNOO.png)

Using the Ford-Fulkerson algorithm, find the maximum flow from source node `S` to sink node `T`. Also, show the corresponding augmented path and residual graph after each iteration of the algorithm until the maximum flow is reached.
message_2:
We will use the Ford-Fulkerson algorithm to find the maximum flow from source node S to sink node T. The algorithm works by iteratively finding augmenting paths in the residual graph and updating the flow along these paths until no more augmenting paths can be found.

Iteration 1:
Augmenting path: S -> A -> D -> T
Bottleneck capacity: min(10, 10, 20) = 10
Residual graph:
```
S --(10)--> A --(10)--> B --(10)--> T
|          ^          |          ^
|(10)      |(10)      v(10)      |(20)
v          |          C          |
D --(10)--> E --(25)--> F --(10)--> T
^          |          ^          |
|(20)      |(10)      |(10)      |(10)
|          v          |          v
T <------- H <------- G <------- F
```

Iteration 2:
Augmenting path: S -> A -> B -> T
Bottleneck capacity: min(10, 10) = 10
Residual graph:
```
S --(10)--> A --(0)--> B --(0)--> T
|          ^          |          ^
|(10)      |(20)      v(10)      |(20)
v          |          C          |
D --(10)--> E --(25)--> F --(10)--> T
^          |          ^          |
|(20)      |(10)      |(10)      |(10)
|          v          |          v
T <------- H <------- G <------- F
```

Iteration 3:
Augmenting path: S -> D -> E -> F -> T
Bottleneck capacity: min(10, 25, 10) = 10
Residual graph:
```
S --(10)--> A --(0)--> B --(0)--> T
|          ^          |          ^
|(0)       |(20)      v(10)      |(20)
v          |          C          |
D --(0)--> E --(15)--> F --(0)--> T
^          |          ^          |
|(30)      |(10)      |(20)      |(0)
|          v          |          v
T <------- H <------- G <------- F
```

No more augmenting paths can be found in the residual graph. Therefore, the maximum flow from source node S to sink node T is the sum of the flows into T, which is 10 + 10 + 10 = 30.
